meanings.definition: Mix (a substance, especially a liquid) with a rod or stick.
meanings.sent1: She was puddling the paint to get the right color.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy puddling the ingredients together when baking.
meanings.sent3: The chef was puddling the sauce with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: The artist puddled the colors on the canvas, creating a beautiful masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: Puddling the soil and water, she formed a perfect mud pie.

meanings.definition: Walk with your feet in shallow water or mud.
meanings.sent1: The children were puddling in the stream on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent2: I love puddling in the rain, feeling the water under my feet.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't resist puddling in the puddle, splashing water everywhere.
meanings.sent4: She imagined herself puddling through a magical swamp in her dream.
meanings.sent5: Puddling in the creek, they searched for shiny rocks and treasures.

meanings.definition: Work as a puddler in a puddling furnace.
meanings.sent1: He learned how to puddle iron in the furnace at the factory.
meanings.sent2: The workers were puddling the metal to shape it into bars.
meanings.sent3: The new employee was excited to start puddling in the hot furnace.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a magician as she puddled the molten metal into molds.
meanings.sent5: Puddling in the intense heat, they transformed raw materials into usable metal.
